title: want my money back
body:
Hi, had an inting syndra in my game (zero lp from demotion) who came to bot 4 times and intentionally fed under tower. I was as reserved as one could possibly be given the stress the situation induced, and yet my account has been permanently banned anyway. One of the following 3 things is going to happen, im posting on this message board so you can decide.

a) lift the wrongful ban on my account, the syndra is the one who should be permanently banned, not myself ( i did everything i could to carry that game and had no negative comments towards teammates sans 1 mildly offensive comment to syndra when she was int feeding our lane)

b) refund me the money i spent on skins for this account, its not much but if youre going to close my account that has items i paid for on it then c is going to happen


c) i will file a lawsuit against RIOT, i have the message logs saved from the game and the transaction reciepts from my skin purchases, and it doesnt bother me in the slightest to pursue this in court. 



awaiting your response, cheers.

* 2.2. What happens if my account is terminated? (No LoL for you.)

We also reserve the right to terminate any other accounts you may have created, as well as your access to any other Riot Services (also without any refunds or liability to you).

You understand and agree that using the Riot Services comes with the risk that your account may be terminated or suspended and that, whenever you use the Riot Services, you’ll bear this risk in mind and always conduct yourself appropriately.

**So nope.
No refunds for you.
That's what happens when you sign a contract or agreed to a policy and don't read it.**

Lmfao.

a) You were toxic regardless. Their actions do not justify yours, unless their action is **literally** forcing you to take that action (Such as them actually holding a gun to your head and ordering you to flame your team). The ban is not wrongful. Also, you got permabanned, which can only happen if you were punished in the past, so you're hardly innocent.

b) ToS says they have absolutely no obligation to do so. If they do, it's solely because they *felt* like doing so.

c) The ToS is a legally binding agreement. You signed away your right to sue them over that by playing League. You **actually** have no legal right to sue them over them banning you and not giving you your money back.
